Articles.Content: saw kurtjmac and scott manley play it.I will admit I played the demo and then later pirated .23,(sorry wanted to know if it was good enough- it was) got a new pc lost ksp, then about 1 week ago I saw .23 sitting in my backup files, so i played an old save and had fun, i check the forums about 6 months after going on haitus later and find out ksp is BETA than ever!.I instantly bought .90 yesterday, good job squad!

The furthest back I can remember it is a few videos and several images I saw browsing over the internet. I only watched anything relating to it in 2013, when I watched Day9's Day Off trying to play it, and a week or two later watching Zisteau (somebody I've followed from afar since 2011 thanks to his Minecraft Super Hostile series) and his series of videos, though not the entire playlist. It wasn't until this last Steam Winter Sale after I got an awesome new computer that could actually run it (and lots more!) that I seriously considered buying it, and soon did. No regrets, except the first moon launch (not enough fuel to return!), the rescue mission (Not enough fuel to even get off the surface!) and the following many attempts to land a 3-pod lander near enough to rescue the now two stranded kerbals.
I was getting interested in the moon landings and space in general and then I happened to click on a video by a certain guy called Scott Manley on YouTube. My fate was sealed from there on...
From the alt-text of this xkcd.

I think I saw an article on KSP on some indie game website. This was back when it was still pretty much a concept rather then a game. Once squad had made the game and released the early alpha though I jumped on it straight away and bought it. I've always been a sucker for space games and this was quite a fair bit different then all the standard space shooter or 4x games.
